definition: to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: This principle can be extended to other angularity error evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 文中的評定原理可擴展到其他傾斜度誤差的評定。

sentences.english: If measured value is much less, gradient can be a little bigger.
sentences.chinese: 當被測參數爲較小的差壓值時，傾斜度可再稍大一點。

sentences.english: The shelves in the living room were designed to follow the diagonal of the wall.
sentences.chinese: 客廳的架子設計成順應着牆面的傾斜度。

sentences.english: Pluto's track mostly was separated from the ecliptic surface, the gradient has amounted to 17.
sentences.chinese: 冥王星的軌道大都脫離了黃道面，傾斜度達17度。

sentences.english: How far does it lean? Nearly five times farther than the Leaning Tower of Pisa in Italy。
sentences.chinese: 其傾斜度幾乎是意大利比薩斜塔傾斜度的5倍。

sentences.english: How far does it lean? Nearly five times farther than the Leaning Tower of Pisa in Italy。
sentences.chinese: 其傾斜度幾乎是意大利比薩斜塔傾斜度的5倍。

definition: (of sth that has been deformed) to spring back to original shape/(fig.) to rebound/to bounce back
dome light (of a taxi etc)/ceiling light (in a room)/interior light (of a car)/light on the top of a mast etc
